goal.core.program.actions

Class SendOnceAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.actions.Action
        • goal.core.program.actions.MentalAction
          • goal.core.program.actions.SendAction
            • goal.core.program.actions.SendOnceAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class SendOnceAction
extends SendAction
    The SendOnceAction is a special kind of send action that requires that the message to be sent has not been sent before yet (to the intended recipients). It checks this by inspecting the agent's mail box for corresponding sent records.

    If only some of the intended recipients have not yet received the message, it will be sent to those agents only.

    Author:
    Wouter de Vries
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Creates a SendOnceAction that sends a message (content) to one or more agents if the message has not yet been sent before.

      MentalStateCond getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
      The precondition of a SendOnceAction is that there is a non-empty set of receivers of the message to be sent that should receive this message but did not receive it yet; otherwise the precondition fails.
